intro: Poikilospermum intermedium, commonly known as the variable sycamore, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that are clustered in terminal panicles. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds with silky filaments. Poikilospermum intermedium is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments.
